Description: The hollow terracotta chest fragment broken from a large Sothic dog, with the hair well indicated, and wearing a double-strand collar, from which depend a bell-like object and a penannular device, which was probably matched by another on the other side of the bell. From a three-piece mould, one join showing on the hound's left side. Micaceous brown Nile silt. Covered with a white dressing; red paint on the collar.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. Excavated at Oxyrhynchus. Roman, first or second century AD. Comparanda: Near: Bayer-Niemeier 1988: no. 627, dated second half of second century AD; Matelly 2003: 609, no. 72, from Maximianon in the Wadi Hammamat, from a context dated between the time of Nero and Marcus Aurelius.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3706)
